rationale: Contractions make text sound more conversational and human; applying a deterministic fraction avoids overuse.
Humans naturally vary sentence length; merging/splitting sentences increases natural rhythm and reduces machine-like regularity.
Em-dash overuse is a strong AI fingerprint; best to allow at most 1 per 500 words and replace extras with commas.

recommendation: Avoid triadic lists and emoji bullets
rationale: AI often emits three-item lists and emoji bullets; merging or reformatting three-item lists and stripping emoji reduces detectability.

recommendation: Replace banned buzzwords with plain alternatives
rationale: Certain marketing buzzwords are overused by AI; deterministic replacement reduces 'AI-scent' while preserving meaning.
Editorial notes (Note:, Edited:) are machine-inserted artifacts; remove conservative patterns while preserving substantive content.
Formulaic hook→ethos→bullets→conclusion patterns are common in AI outputs; heuristically detect and convert to natural paragraphs.
Short markers (That said, Still,) increase human-like discourse flow when used sparingly (5-10% of paragraph starts).
